title: 7-Day Lima and Cusco Tour with Sunrise at Machu Picchu
description: Make the most of your limited time in Peru on a 7-day tour that covers the country’s key highlights. Skip the stress of planning—accommodation, transport, and entry tickets are all arranged in advance. A guide enhances the experience with insights not found in guidebooks, allowing for a deeper understanding of Peru’s rich history, culture, and highlights.
all_descriptions: Make the most of your limited time in Peru on a 7-day tour that covers the country’s key highlights. Skip the stress of planning—accommodation, transport, and entry tickets are all arranged in advance. A guide enhances the experience with insights not found in guidebooks, allowing for a deeper understanding of Peru’s rich history, culture, and highlights.

Day 1 of your Peruvian adventure begins with a hassle-free arrival in Lima and free time to relax or explore independently. 

Day 2 features Lima's historic core, the Plaza de Armas and the Cathedral. The guided tour ventures into modern districts, revealing archaeological gems like Huaca Huallamarca and Huaca Pucllana pyramids. 

On Day 3, comfortable transportation takes you to Cusco, the Inca capital, where you'll visit Qorikancha, San Blas, and the Plaza de Armas. 

Day 4 delves into the archaeological wonders of Sacsayhuaman, Q'enqo, and Tambomachay. 

The following morning, the adventure continues at the Sacred Valley's Chinchero, Moray, and Ollantaytambo, culminating in a train journey to Aguas Calientes. 

Day 6 is dedicated to the iconic Machu Picchu, a UNESCO World Heritage site. 

Finally, Day 7 bids farewell with a hassle-free return to Lima. 

Throughout the week-long journey, enjoy complimentary breakfast, all-inclusive transportation, and immersive guided tours.

Bucket list trip!

Aug 2025 • Family
I booked this 7-day tour for my 50th birthday and it was truly amazing! Here are the pros and cons of the trip:
Pros:
Vipac Travel was very organized. We had a driver and a guide each day and they were always on time and very informative.
Action packed itinerary. We never felt like we had too much free time (just enough).
I felt like this 7-day tour covered all the best archaeological sites in the area.
Cons:
Train station in Ollyantatambo was very confusing. Nobody spoke English there to help us. They come in with lettered signs and do a little dance, but then you have no idea what to do if you don't speak Spanish. It was extremely frustrating.
Every day was an early morning pickup (typically 7am). Several times we had to get breakfast to go from the hotel because the restaurants were not open yet by the time we had to check out.
I booked the "Economy Triple" package since it was myself, my husband, and our daughter. That was a mistake! The hotels we stayed at were terrible! After long days of hiking and traveling, we came back to hotels with horribly uncomfortable beds and hit or miss hot water in the showers. One even had a radiator for us to plug in to heat the room.
Overall:
Great trip! None of the Cons we necessarily due to Vipac. I chose the economy package so I should have expected lower class hotels. Other than the frustrating day at the train station, the rest of the trip went very smoothly. I would definitely reccommend booking this package through Vipac. :)

We flew in a night early on our dime and stayed at Wyndham right across the street from the airport. We had told the tour people about our plans earlier and they picked us there and took us to their first night’s hotel (we did not know it’s name, but in our case it was Casa Andina Select. Others might have had different hotels, I don’t know.). The tour company took over the hotels and connections from Lima to Cusco to Aguascalientes, and they never missed a beat. We were required to book our own flight from Lima to Cusco and the return and tell them our reservations details. My wife and I booked an extra night in the same Wyndham airport hotel on an extra night at the end of the trip so we would not have to rush and would be rested.
